   23: -module(ssh_protocol_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet.hrl").
   27: -include("ssh.hrl").		% ?UINT32, ?BYTE, #ssh{} ...
   28: -include("ssh_transport.hrl").
   29: -include("ssh_auth.hrl").
   30: -include("ssh_test_lib.hrl").
   31: 
   32: -export([
   33:          suite/0,
   34:          all/0,
   35:          groups/0,
   36:          init_per_suite/1,
   37:          end_per_suite/1,
   38:          init_per_testcase/2,
   39:          end_per_testcase/2
   40:         ]).
   41: 
   42: -export([
   43:          bad_long_service_name/1,
   44:          bad_packet_length/2,
   45:          bad_service_name/1,
   46:          bad_service_name/2,
   47:          bad_service_name_length/2,
   48:          bad_service_name_then_correct/1,
   49:          bad_very_long_service_name/1,
   50:          client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds/1,
   51:          client_handles_banner_keyboard_interactive/1,
   52:          client_info_line/1,
   53:          do_gex_client_init/3,
   54:          do_gex_client_init_old/3,
   55:          empty_service_name/1,
   56:          ext_info_c/1,
   57:          ext_info_s/1,
   58:          kex_strict_negotiated/1,
   59:          kex_strict_msg_ignore/1,
   60:          kex_strict_msg_unknown/1,
   61:          gex_client_init_option_groups/1,
   62:          gex_client_init_option_groups_file/1,
   63:          gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file/1,
   64:          gex_client_old_request_exact/1,
   65:          gex_client_old_request_noexact/1,
   66:          gex_server_gex_limit/1,
   67:          lib_match/1,
   68:          lib_no_match/1,
   69:          lib_works_as_client/1,
   70:          lib_works_as_server/1,
   71:          modify_append/1,
   72:          modify_combo/1,
   73:          modify_prepend/1,
   74:          modify_rm/1,
   75:          no_common_alg_client_disconnects/1,
   76:          no_common_alg_server_disconnects/1,
   77:          no_ext_info_s1/1,
   78:          no_ext_info_s2/1,
   79:          packet_length_too_large/1,
   80:          packet_length_too_short/1,
   81:          preferred_algorithms/1,
   82:          service_name_length_too_large/1,
   83:          service_name_length_too_short/1,
   84:          client_close_after_hello/1
   85:         ]).
   86: 
   87: -define(NEWLINE, <<"\r\n">>).
   88: -define(REKEY_DATA_TMO, 65000).
   89: 
   90: -define(DEFAULT_KEX, 'diffie-hellman-group14-sha256').
   91: -define(EXTRA_KEX, 'diffie-hellman-group1-sha1').
   92: 
   93: -define(CIPHERS, ['aes256-ctr','aes192-ctr','aes128-ctr','aes128-cbc','3des-cbc']).
   94: -define(DEFAULT_CIPHERS, (fun() -> Ciphs = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
   95:                                    [{client2server,Ciphs}, {server2client,Ciphs}]
   96:                           end)()
   97:         ).
   98: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   99: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  100: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  101: suite() ->
  102:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  103:      {timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  104: 
  105: all() -> 
  106:     [{group,tool_tests},
  107:      client_info_line,
  108:      {group,kex},
  109:      {group,service_requests},
  110:      {group,authentication},
  111:      {group,packet_size_error},
  112:      {group,field_size_error},
  113:      {group,ext_info},
  114:      {group,preferred_algorithms},
  115:      {group,client_close_early}
  116:     ].
  117: 
  118: groups() ->
  119:     [{tool_tests, [], [lib_works_as_client,
  120: 		       lib_works_as_server,
  121: 		       lib_match,
  122: 		       lib_no_match
  123: 		      ]},
  124:      {packet_size_error, [], [packet_length_too_large,
  125: 			      packet_length_too_short]},
  126:       
  127:      {field_size_error, [], [service_name_length_too_large,
  128: 			     service_name_length_too_short]},
  129:       
  130:      {kex, [], [no_common_alg_server_disconnects,
  131: 		no_common_alg_client_disconnects,
  132: 		gex_client_init_option_groups,
  133: 		gex_server_gex_limit,
  134: 		gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file,
  135: 		gex_client_init_option_groups_file,
  136: 		gex_client_old_request_exact,
  137: 		gex_client_old_request_noexact,
  138:                 kex_strict_negotiated,
  139:                 kex_strict_msg_ignore,
  140:                 kex_strict_msg_unknown]},
  141:      {service_requests, [], [bad_service_name,
  142: 			     bad_long_service_name,
  143: 			     bad_very_long_service_name,
  144: 			     empty_service_name,
  145: 			     bad_service_name_then_correct
  146: 			    ]},
  147:      {authentication, [], [client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds,
  148:                            client_handles_banner_keyboard_interactive
  149: 			  ]},
  150:      {ext_info, [], [no_ext_info_s1,
  151:                      no_ext_info_s2,
  152:                      ext_info_s,
  153:                      ext_info_c
  154:                     ]},
  155:      {preferred_algorithms, [], [preferred_algorithms,
  156:                                  modify_append,
  157:                                  modify_prepend,
  158:                                  modify_rm,
  159:                                  modify_combo
  160:                                 ]},
  161:      {client_close_early, [], [client_close_after_hello
  162:                                ]}
  163:     ].
  164: 
  165: 
  166: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  167:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(start_std_daemon( setup_dirs( start_apps(Config)))).
  168: 
  169: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  170:     stop_apps(Config).
  171: 
  172: init_per_testcase(no_common_alg_server_disconnects, Config) ->
  173:     start_std_daemon(Config, [{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-rsa']},
  174:                                                      {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  175:                                                     ]}]);
  176: init_per_testcase(kex_strict_negotiated, Config) ->
  177:     Config;
  178: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == gex_client_init_option_groups ;
  179: 				   TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ;
  180: 				   TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_file ;
  181: 				   TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  182: 				   TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  183: 				   TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  184:     Opts = case TC of
  185: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups ->
  186: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, 
  187:                      [{1023, 5, 
  188:                        16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A770E2EC9F
  189:                       }]}];
  190: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups_file ->
  191: 		   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  192: 		   F = filename:join(DataDir, "dh_group_test"),
  193: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, {file,F}}];
  194: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ->
  195: 		   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  196: 		   F = filename:join(DataDir, "dh_group_test.moduli"),
  197: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, {ssh_moduli_file,F}}];
  198: 	       _ when TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  199: 		      TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  200: 		      TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  201: 		    [{dh_gex_groups, 
  202:                       [{1023, 2, 16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A771225323},
  203:                        {1535, 5, 16#D1391174233D315398FE2830AC6B2B66BCCD01B0A634899F339B7879F1DB85712E9DC4E4B1C6C8355570C1D2DCB53493DF18175A9C53D1128B592B4C72D97136F5542FEB981CBFE8012FDD30361F288A42BD5EBB08BAB0A5640E1AC48763B2ABD1945FEE36B2D55E1D50A1C86CED9DD141C4E7BE2D32D9B562A0F8E2E927020E91F58B57EB9ACDDA106A59302D7E92AD5F6E851A45FA1CFE86029A0F727F65A8F475F33572E2FDAB6073F0C21B8B54C3823DB2EF068927E5D747498F96E1E827},
  204:                        {3071, 2, 16#DFAA35D35531E0F524F0099877A482D2AC8D589F374394A262A8E81A8A4FB2F65FADBAB395E05D147B29D486DFAA41F41597A256DA82A8B6F76401AED53D0253F956CEC610D417E42E3B287F7938FC24D8821B40BFA218A956EB7401BED6C96C68C7FD64F8170A8A76B953DD2F05420118F6B144D8FE48060A2BCB85056B478EDEF96DBC70427053ECD2958C074169E9550DD877779A3CF17C5AC850598C7586BEEA9DCFE9DD2A5FB62DF5F33EA7BC00CDA31B9D2DD721F979EA85B6E63F0C4E30BDDCD3A335522F9004C4ED50B15DC537F55324DD4FA119FB3F101467C6D7E1699DE4B3E3C478A8679B8EB3FA5C9B826B44530FD3BE9AD3063B240B0C853EBDDBD68DD940332D98F148D5D9E1DC977D60A0D23D0CA1198637FEAE4E7FAAC173AF2B84313A666CFB4EE6972811921D0AD867CE57F3BBC8D6CB057E3B66757BB46C9F72662624D44E14528327E3A7100E81A12C43C4E236118318CD90C8AA185BBB0C764826DAEAEE8DD245C5B451B4944E6122CC522D1C335C2EEF9429825A2B}
  205:                       ]},
  206:                      {dh_gex_limits, {1023,2000}}
  207: 		    ];
  208: 	       _ ->
  209: 		   []
  210: 	   end,
  211:     start_std_daemon(Config,
  212: 		     [{preferred_algorithms,[{cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  213:                                             ]}
  214: 		      | Opts]);
  215: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  216:     check_std_daemon_works(Config, ?LINE).
  217: 
  218: end_per_testcase(no_common_alg_server_disconnects, Config) ->
  219:     stop_std_daemon(Config);
  220: end_per_testcase(kex_strict_negotiated, Config) ->
  221:     Config;
  222: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == gex_client_init_option_groups ;
  223: 				  TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ;
  224: 				  TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_file ;
  225: 				  TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  226: 				  TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  227: 				  TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  228:     stop_std_daemon(Config);
  229: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  230:     check_std_daemon_works(Config, ?LINE).
  231: 
  232: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  233: %%% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  234: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  235: 
  236: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  237: %%% Connect to an erlang server and check that the testlib acts as a client.
  238: lib_works_as_client(Config) ->
  239:     %% Connect and negotiate keys
  240:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  241: 			  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]}]
  242: 			 ),
  243:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex(Config, InitialState),
  244: 
  245:     %% Do the authentcation
  246:     {User,Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  247:     {ok,EndState} =
  248: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  249: 	  [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  250: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  251: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{user = User,
  252: 					    service = "ssh-connection",
  253: 					    method = "password",
  254: 					    data = <<?BOOLEAN(?FALSE),
  255: 						     ?STRING(unicode:characters_to_binary(Pwd))>>
  256: 					   }},
  257: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  258: 	  ], AfterKexState),
  259: 
  260:     %% Disconnect
  261:     {ok,_} =
  262: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  263: 	  [{send, #ssh_msg_disconnect{code = ?SSH_DISCONNECT_BY_APPLICATION,
  264: 				      description = "End of the fun",
  265: 				      language = ""
  266: 				     }},
  267: 	   close_socket
  268: 	  ], EndState).
  269: 
  270: 
  271: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  272: %%% Connect an erlang client and check that the testlib can act as a server.
  273: lib_works_as_server(Config) ->
  274:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  275: 
  276:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  277:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  278:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  279: 
  280:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  281:     spawn_link(
  282:       fun() ->
  283: 	      {ok,_} =
  284: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  285: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  286: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  287: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  288: 		     receive_hello,
  289: 		     {send, hello},
  290: 
  291: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  292: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  293: 
  294: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  295: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  296: 
  297: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  298: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  299: 
  300: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  301: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  302: 
  303: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  304: 						       method="none",
  305: 						       user=User,
  306: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  307: 
  308: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "password",
  309: 						      partial_success = false}},
  310: 
  311: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  312: 						       method="password",
  313: 						       user=User,
  314: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  315: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  316: 		     close_socket,
  317: 		     print_state
  318: 		    ],
  319: 		    InitialState)
  320:       end),
  321: 
  322:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  323:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  324: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  325:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  326:                                                 ]}
  327:                          ]
  328: 			).
  329: 
  330: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  331: %%% Matching
  332: lib_match(_Config) ->
  333:     {ok,_} =
  334: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([{set_options, [print_ops]},
  335: 				{match, abc, abc},
  336: 				{match, '$a', {cde,fgh}},
  337: 				{match, {cde,fgh}, '$a'},
  338: 				{match, '_', {cde,fgh}},
  339: 				{match, [a,'$a',b], [a,{cde,fgh},b]},
  340: 				{match, [a,'$a'|'$b'], [a,{cde,fgh},b,c]},
  341: 				{match, '$b', [b,c]}
  342: 			       ]).
  343: 
  344: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  345: %%% Not matching
  346: lib_no_match(_Config) ->
  347:     case ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([{set_options, [print_ops]},
  348: 				 {match, '$x', b},
  349: 				 {match, a, '$x'}])
  350:     of
  351: 	{ok,_} -> {fail,"Unexpected match"};
  352: 	{error, {_Op,{expected,a,b},_State}} -> ok
  353:     end.
  354: 
  355: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  356: %%% Algo negotiation fail.  This should result in a ssh_msg_disconnect
  357: %%% being sent from the server.
  358: no_common_alg_server_disconnects(Config) ->
  359:     {ok,_} =
  360: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  361: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  362: 	   {connect,
  363: 	    ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
  364: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  365: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  366: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  367: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-dss']},
  368:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  369:                                    ]}
  370: 	    ]},
  371: 	   receive_hello,
  372: 	   {send, hello},
  373: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  374: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},  % with server unsupported 'ssh-dss' !
  375: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  376: 	  ]
  377: 	 ).
  378: 
  379: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  380: %%% Algo negotiation fail.  This should result in a ssh_msg_disconnect
  381: %%% being sent from the client.
  382: no_common_alg_client_disconnects(Config) ->
  383:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  384:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  385:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  386:     Parent = self(),
  387: 
  388:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  389:     Pid =
  390: 	spawn_link(
  391: 	  fun() ->
  392: 		  Parent !
  393: 		      {result,self(),
  394: 		       ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  395: 			 [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  396: 			  {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  397: 				    {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  398: 			  receive_hello,
  399: 			  {send, hello},
  400: 			  {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  401: 			  {send,  #ssh_msg_kexinit{ % with unsupported "SOME-UNSUPPORTED"
  402: 				     cookie = <<80,158,95,51,174,35,73,130,246,141,200,49,180,190,82,234>>,
  403: 				     kex_algorithms = [atom_to_list(?DEFAULT_KEX)],
  404: 				     server_host_key_algorithms = ["SOME-UNSUPPORTED"],  % SIC!
  405: 				     encryption_algorithms_client_to_server = ["aes128-ctr"],
  406: 				     encryption_algorithms_server_to_client = ["aes128-ctr"],
  407: 				     mac_algorithms_client_to_server = ["hmac-sha2-256"],
  408: 				     mac_algorithms_server_to_client = ["hmac-sha2-256"],
  409: 				     compression_algorithms_client_to_server = ["none"],
  410: 				     compression_algorithms_server_to_client = ["none"],
  411: 				     languages_client_to_server = [],
  412: 				     languages_server_to_client = [],
  413: 				     first_kex_packet_follows = false,
  414: 				     reserved = 0
  415: 				    }},
  416: 			  {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}
  417: 			 ],
  418: 			 InitialState)
  419: 		      }
  420: 	  end),
  421: 
  422:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client
  423:     %% which of course does not support SOME-UNSUPPORTED as pub key algo:
  424:     Result = std_connect(HostPort, Config, [{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-dss']},
  425:                                                                    {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  426:                                                                   ]}]),
  427:     ct:log("Result of connect is ~p",[Result]),
  428: 
  429:     receive
  430: 	{result,Pid,{ok,_}} -> 
  431: 	    ok;
  432: 	{result,Pid,{error,{Op,ExecResult,S}}} ->
  433: 	    ct:log("ERROR!~nOp = ~p~nExecResult = ~p~nState =~n~s",
  434: 		   [Op,ExecResult,ssh_trpt_test_lib:format_msg(S)]),
  435: 	    {fail, ExecResult};
  436: 	X -> 
  437: 	    ct:log("¤¤¤¤¤"),
  438: 	    ct:fail(X)
  439:     after 
  440: 	30000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  441:     end.
  442: 
  443: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  444: gex_client_init_option_groups(Config) ->
  445:     do_gex_client_init(Config, {512, 2048, 4000},
  446: 		       {5,16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A770E2EC9F}
  447:                       ).

  459: gex_server_gex_limit(Config) ->

  465: 
  466: do_gex_client_init(Config, {Min,N,Max}, {G,P}) ->
  467:     {ok,_} =
  468: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  469: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  470: 	   {connect,
  471: 	    ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
  472: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  473: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  474: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  475: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,['diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256']},
  476:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  477:                                    ]}
  478: 	    ]},
  479: 	   receive_hello,
  480: 	   {send, hello},
  481: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  482: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  483: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_request{min = Min, 
  484: 					      n = N,
  485: 					      max = Max}},
  486: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_group{p=P, g=G, _='_'},  receive_msg}
  487: 	  ]
  488: 	 ).
  489: 
  490: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------

  494:                            ).

  499:                            ).

  508: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  509: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  510: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,['diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256']},
  511:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  512:                                    ]}
  513: 	    ]},
  514: 	   receive_hello,
  515: 	   {send, hello},

  523: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  524: bad_service_name(Config) -> 
  525:     bad_service_name(Config, "kfglkjf").
  526:     
  527: bad_long_service_name(Config) -> 
  528:     bad_service_name(Config, 
  529: 		     lists:duplicate(?SSH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE div 2, $a)).
  530: 
  531: bad_very_long_service_name(Config) -> 
  532:     bad_service_name(Config,
  533: 		     lists:duplicate(?SSH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE+5, $a)).
  534: 
  535: empty_service_name(Config) ->
  536:     bad_service_name(Config, "").
  537:     
  538: bad_service_name_then_correct(Config) ->
  539:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  540:     {ok,_} =
  541: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  542: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  543: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "kdjglkfdjgkldfjglkdfjglkfdjglkj"}},
  544: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-connection"}},
  545: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  546: 	   ], InitialState).
  547: 
  548: 
  549: bad_service_name(Config, Name) ->
  550:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  551:     {ok,_} =
  552: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  553: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  554: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = Name}},
  555: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  556: 	  ], InitialState).
  557: 
  558: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  559: packet_length_too_large(Config) -> bad_packet_length(Config, +4).
  560: 
  561: packet_length_too_short(Config) -> bad_packet_length(Config, -4).
  562:     
  563: bad_packet_length(Config, LengthExcess) ->
  564:     PacketFun = 
  565: 	fun(Msg, Ssh) ->
  566: 		BinMsg = ssh_message:encode(Msg),
  567: 		ssh_transport:pack(BinMsg, Ssh, LengthExcess)
  568: 	end,
  569:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  570:     {ok,_} =
  571: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  572: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  573: 	   {send, {special,
  574: 		   #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"},
  575: 		   PacketFun}},
  576: 	   %% Prohibit remote decoder starvation:	   
  577: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  578: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  579: 	  ], InitialState).
  580: 
  581: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  582: service_name_length_too_large(Config) -> bad_service_name_length(Config, +4).
  583: 
  584: service_name_length_too_short(Config) -> bad_service_name_length(Config, -4).
  585: 
  586: 
  587: bad_service_name_length(Config, LengthExcess) ->
  588:     PacketFun = 
  589: 	fun(#ssh_msg_service_request{name=Service}, Ssh) ->
  590: 		BinName = list_to_binary(Service),
  591: 		BinMsg = 
  592: 		    <<?BYTE(?SSH_MSG_SERVICE_REQUEST),
  593: 		      %% A bad string encoding of Service:
  594: 		      ?UINT32(size(BinName)+LengthExcess), BinName/binary
  595: 		    >>,
  596: 		ssh_transport:pack(BinMsg, Ssh)
  597: 	end,
  598:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  599:     {ok,_} =
  600: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  601: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  602: 	   {send, {special,
  603: 		   #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, 
  604: 		   PacketFun} },
  605: 	   %% Prohibit remote decoder starvation:	   
  606: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  607: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  608: 	  ], InitialState).
  609:     
  610: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  611: %%% This is due to a fault report (OTP-13255) with OpenSSH-6.6.1
  612: client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds(Config) ->
  613:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  614: 
  615:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  616:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  617:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  618: 
  619:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  620:     spawn_link(
  621:       fun() ->
  622: 	      {ok,_} =
  623: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  624: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  625: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  626: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  627: 		     receive_hello,
  628: 		     {send, hello},
  629: 
  630: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  631: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  632: 
  633: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  634: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  635: 
  636: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  637: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  638: 
  639: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  640: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  641: 
  642: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  643: 						       method="none",
  644: 						       user=User,
  645: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  646: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "keyboard-interactive",
  647: 						      partial_success = false}},
  648: 		     
  649: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  650: 						       method="keyboard-interactive",
  651: 						       user=User,
  652: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  653: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  654: 							   instruction = "",
  655: 							   language_tag = "",
  656: 							   num_prompts = 1,
  657: 							   data = <<0,0,0,10,80,97,115,115,119,111,114,100,58,32,0>>
  658: 							  }},
  659: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 1,
  660: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  661: 		      
  662: 		     %% the next is strange, but openssh 6.6.1 does this and this is what this testcase is about
  663: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  664: 							   instruction = "",
  665: 							   language_tag = "",
  666: 							   num_prompts = 0,
  667: 							   data = <<>>
  668: 							  }},
  669: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 0,
  670: 							     data = <<>>,
  671: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  672: 		     %% Here we know that the tested fault is fixed
  673: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  674: 		     close_socket,
  675: 		     print_state
  676: 		    ],
  677: 		    InitialState)
  678:       end),
  679: 
  680:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  681:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  682: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  683:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  684:                                                 ]}]
  685: 			).
  686: 
  687: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  688: %%% SSH_MSG_USERAUTH_BANNER can be sent at any time during user auth.
  689: %%% The following test mimics a SSH server implementation that sends the banner
  690: %%% immediately before sending SSH_MSG_USERAUTH_SUCCESS.
  691: client_handles_banner_keyboard_interactive(Config) ->
  692:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  693: 
  694:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  695:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  696:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  697: 
  698:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  699:     spawn_link(
  700:       fun() ->
  701: 	      {ok,_} =
  702: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  703: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  704: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  705: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  706: 		     receive_hello,
  707: 		     {send, hello},
  708: 
  709: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  710: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  711: 
  712: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  713: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  714: 
  715: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  716: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  717: 
  718: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  719: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  720: 
  721: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  722: 						       method="none",
  723: 						       user=User,
  724: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  725: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "keyboard-interactive",
  726: 						      partial_success = false}},
  727: 
  728: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  729: 						       method="keyboard-interactive",
  730: 						       user=User,
  731: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  732: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  733: 							   instruction = "",
  734: 							   language_tag = "",
  735: 							   num_prompts = 1,
  736: 							   data = <<0,0,0,10,80,97,115,115,119,111,114,100,58,32,0>>
  737: 							  }},
  738: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 1,
  739: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  740: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  741: 							   instruction = "",
  742: 							   language_tag = "",
  743: 							   num_prompts = 0,
  744: 							   data = <<>>
  745: 							  }},
  746: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 0,
  747: 							     data = <<>>,
  748: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  749:                      {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_banner{message = "Banner\n"}},
  750: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  751: 		     close_socket,
  752: 		     print_state
  753: 		    ],
  754: 		    InitialState)
  755:       end),
  756: 
  757:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  758:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config,
  759: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  760:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  761:                                                 ]}]
  762: 			).
  763: 
  764: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  765: client_info_line(Config) ->
  766:     %% A client must not send an info-line. If it does, the server should handle
  767:     %% handle this gracefully
  768:     {ok,Pid} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:add_report_handler(),
  769:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  770:     {_, _, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir,DataDir}]),
  771: 
  772:     %% Fake client:
  773:     {ok,S} = gen_tcp:connect("localhost",Port,[]),
  774:     gen_tcp:send(S,"An illegal info-string\r\n"),
  775:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  776: 
  777:     %% wait for server to react:
  778:     timer:sleep(1000),
  779: 
  780:     %% check if a badmatch was received:
  781:     {ok, Reports} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:get_reports(Pid),
  782:     case lists:any(fun({error_report,_,{_,supervisor_report,L}}) when is_list(L) -> 
  783: 			   lists:member({reason,{badmatch,{error,closed}}}, L);
  784: 		      (_) ->
  785: 			   false
  786: 		   end, Reports) of
  787: 	true ->
  788: 	    ct:fail("Bad error report on info_line from client");
  789: 	false ->
  790: 	    ok
  791:     end.
  792: 	
  793: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  794: %%% The server does not send the extension because
  795: %%% the client does not tell the server to send it
  796: no_ext_info_s1(Config) ->
  797:     %% Start the daemon
  798:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,true},
  799:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  800:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{server,Server}|Config]),
  801:     {ok,_} = 
  802:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  803:           [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  804: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg}
  805:           ], AfterKexState),
  806:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  807: 
  808: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  809: %%% The server does not send the extension because
  810: %%% the server is not configured to send it
  811: no_ext_info_s2(Config) ->    
  812:     %% Start the daemon
  813:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,false},
  814:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  815:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{extra_options,[{recv_ext_info,true}]},
  816:                                           {server,Server}
  817:                                           | Config]),
  818:     {ok,_} =
  819:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  820:           [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  821: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg}
  822:           ], AfterKexState),
  823:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  824: 
  825: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  826: %%% The server sends the extension
  827: ext_info_s(Config) ->    
  828:     %% Start the daemon
  829:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,true},
  830:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  831:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{extra_options,[{recv_ext_info,true}]},
  832:                                           {server,Server}
  833:                                           | Config]),
  834:     {ok,_} =
  835:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  836:           [{match, #ssh_msg_ext_info{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  837:           ],
  838:           AfterKexState),
  839:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  840: 
  841: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  842: %%% The client sends the extension
  843: ext_info_c(Config) ->    
  844:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  845:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  846:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  847: 
  848:     Parent = self(),
  849:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  850:     Pid =
  851:         spawn_link(
  852:           fun() ->
  853:                   Result =
  854:                       ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  855:                         [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  856:                          {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  857:                                    {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  858:                                    {recv_ext_info, true}
  859:                                   ]},
  860:                          receive_hello,
  861:                          {send, hello},
  862:                          
  863:                          {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  864:                          {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  865:                          
  866:                          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  867:                          {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  868: 
  869:                          {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  870:                          {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  871: 
  872:                          {match, #ssh_msg_ext_info{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  873: 
  874:                          close_socket,
  875:                          print_state
  876:                         ],
  877:                         InitialState),
  878:                   Parent ! {result,self(),Result}
  879:           end),
  880: 
  881:     %% connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client
  882:     %% (expect error due to the close_socket in daemon):
  883:     {error,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  884:                             [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  885:                                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  886:                                                    ]},
  887:                              {tstflg, [{ext_info_client,true}]},
  888:                              {send_ext_info, true}
  889:                             ]
  890:                            ),
  891:     
  892:     %% Check that the daemon got expected result:
  893:     receive
  894:         {result, Pid, {ok,_}} -> ok;
  895:         {result, Pid, Error} -> ct:fail("Error: ~p",[Error])
  896:     end.
  897: 
  898: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  899: %%%
  900: kex_strict_negotiated(Config0) ->
  901:     {ok, TestRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  902:     Config = start_std_daemon(Config0, []),
  903:     {Server, Host, Port} = proplists:get_value(server, Config),
  904:     Level = ssh_test_lib:get_log_level(),
  905:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(debug),
  906:     {ok, ConnRef} = std_connect({Host, Port}, Config, []),
  907:     {algorithms, _A} = ssh:connection_info(ConnRef, algorithms),
  908:     ssh:stop_daemon(Server),
  909:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(TestRef),
  910:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(client, Events),
  911:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(server, Events),
  912:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(Level),
  913:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  914:     ok.
  915: 
  916: %% Connect to an erlang server and inject unexpected SSH ignore
  917: kex_strict_msg_ignore(Config) ->
  918:     ct:log("START: ~p~n=================================", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  919:     ExpectedReason = "strict KEX violation: unexpected SSH_MSG_IGNORE",
  920:     TestMessages =
  921:         [{send, ssh_msg_ignore},
  922:          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  923:          {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}],
  924:     kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason).
  925: 
  926: %% Connect to an erlang server and inject unexpected non-SSH binary
  927: kex_strict_msg_unknown(Config) ->
  928:     ct:log("START: ~p~n=================================", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  929:     ExpectedReason = "Bad packet: Size",
  930:     TestMessages =
  931:         [{send, ssh_msg_unknown},
  932:          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  933:          {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}],
  934:     kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason).
  935: 
  936: kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason) ->
  937:     {ok, TestRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  938:     Level = ssh_test_lib:get_log_level(),
  939:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(debug),
  940:     %% Connect and negotiate keys
  941:     {ok, InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  942: 			  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]}]
  943: 			 ),
  944:     {ok, _AfterKexState} =
  945:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  946:           [{connect,
  947:             ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
  948:             [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  949:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  950:                                    ]},
  951:              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  952:              {recv_ext_info, false},
  953:              {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  954:              {user_interaction, false}
  955:             | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
  956:             ]},
  957:            receive_hello,
  958:            {send, hello},
  959:            {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  960:            {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  961:            {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_init}] ++
  962:               TestMessages,
  963:           InitialState),
  964:     ct:sleep(100),
  965:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(TestRef),
  966:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  967:     ct:log("Events = ~p", [Events]),
  968:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(client, Events),
  969:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(server, Events),
  970:     true = ssh_test_lib:event_logged(server, Events, ExpectedReason),
  971:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(Level),
  972:     ok.
  973: 
  974: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  975: %%%
  976: preferred_algorithms(Config) ->
  977:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  978:     {error,{eoptions,{{preferred_algorithms,{kex,[some_unknown_algo]}},
  979:                       "Unsupported value(s) found"}}} =
  980:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  981:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX],
  982:                       Ciphers,
  983:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  984:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  985:                                               ]}
  986:                       ]).
  987: 
  988: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  989: %%%
  990: modify_append(Config) ->
  991:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  992:     {ok,_} =
  993:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  994:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, ?EXTRA_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
  995:                       Ciphers,
  996:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  997:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  998:                                               ]},
  999:                        {modify_algorithms, [{append,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}]}]}
 1000:                       ]).
 1001: 
 1002: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1003: %%%
 1004: modify_prepend(Config) ->
 1005:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
 1006:     {ok,_} =
 1007:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1008:                       [?EXTRA_KEX, ?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
 1009:                       Ciphers,
 1010:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1011:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
 1012:                                               ]},
 1013:                        {modify_algorithms, [{prepend,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}]}]}
 1014:                       ]).
 1015: 
 1016: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1017: %%%
 1018: modify_rm(Config) ->
 1019:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
 1020:     {ok,_} =
 1021:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1022:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
 1023:                       tl(Ciphers),
 1024:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX,?EXTRA_KEX]},
 1025:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
 1026:                                               ]},
 1027:                        {modify_algorithms, [{rm,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]},
 1028:                                                  {cipher,[hd(Ciphers)]}
 1029:                                                 ]}
 1030:                                            ]}
 1031:                       ]).
 1032: 
 1033: 
 1034: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1035: %%%
 1036: modify_combo(Config) ->
 1037:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
 1038:     LastC = lists:last(Ciphers),
 1039:     {ok,_} =
 1040:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1041:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
 1042:                       [LastC] ++ (tl(Ciphers)--[LastC]) ++ [hd(Ciphers)],
 1043:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX,?EXTRA_KEX]},
 1044:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
 1045:                                               ]},
 1046:                        {modify_algorithms, [{rm,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}
 1047:                                                 ]},
 1048:                                             {prepend,[{cipher,[{server2client,[LastC]}]}
 1049:                                                      ]},
 1050:                                             {append,[{cipher,[a,hd(Ciphers),b]}
 1051:                                                     ]}
 1052:                                            ]}
 1053:                       ]).
 1054: 
 1055: 
 1056: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1057: %%%
 1058: client_close_after_hello(Config0) ->
 1059:     MaxSessions = 20,
 1060:     SleepSec = 15,
 1061:     Config = start_std_daemon(Config0, [{parallel_login,true},
 1062:                                         {max_sessions,MaxSessions},
 1063:                                         {negotiation_timeout,SleepSec*1000}
 1064:                                        ]),
 1065:     {_Parents0, Conns0, []} =
 1066:         ssh_test_lib:find_handshake_parent(ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)),
 1067:     Cs =
 1068:         [ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1069:            [{connect,
 1070:              ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1071:              [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1072:                                      {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
 1073:                                     ]},
 1074:               {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1075:               {recv_ext_info, false},
 1076:               {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1077:               {user_interaction, false}
 1078:               | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
 1079:              ]},
 1080:             {send, hello}
 1081:            ]) || _ <- lists:seq(1,MaxSessions+100)],
 1082:     ct:log("=== Tried to start ~p sessions.", [length(Cs)]),
 1083:     ssh_info:print(fun ct:log/2),
 1084:     {Parents, Conns, Handshakers} =
 1085:         ssh_test_lib:find_handshake_parent(ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)),
 1086:     ct:log("Found (Port=~p):~n"
 1087:            "  Connections  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1088:            "  Handshakers  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1089:            "  with parents (length ~p): ~p",
 1090:            [ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1091:             length(Conns), Conns,
 1092:             length(Handshakers), Handshakers,
 1093:             length(Parents), Parents]),
 1094:     if
 1095:         length(Handshakers) == 0 -> % no handshakers are created after parallel_login rewrite
 1096:             lists:foreach(fun(P) -> exit(P,some_reason) end, Parents),
 1097:             ct:log("After sending exits; now going to sleep", []),
 1098:             timer:sleep((SleepSec+15)*1000),
 1099:             ct:log("After sleeping", []),
 1100:             ssh_info:print(fun ct:log/2),
 1101:             {Parents2, Conns2, Handshakers2} =
 1102:                 ssh_test_lib:find_handshake_parent(ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)),
 1103:             ct:log("Found (Port=~p):~n"
 1104:                    "  Connections  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1105:                    "  Handshakers  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1106:                    "  with parents (length ~p): ~p",
 1107:                    [ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1108:                     length(Conns2), Conns2,
 1109:                     length(Handshakers2), Handshakers2,
 1110:                     length(Parents2), Parents2]),
 1111:             if
 1112:                 Handshakers2==[] andalso Conns2==Conns0 ->
 1113:                     ok;
 1114:                 Handshakers2=/=[] ->
 1115:                     ct:log("Handshakers still alive: ~p", [Handshakers2]),
 1116:                     {fail, handshakers_alive};
 1117:                 true ->
 1118:                     ct:log("Connections before: ~p~n"
 1119:                            "Connections after: ~p", [Conns0,Conns2]),
 1120:                     {fail, connections_bad}
 1121:             end;
 1122: 
 1123:         true ->
 1124:             {fail, handshakers_found}
 1125:     end.
 1126: 
 1127: 
 1128: %%%================================================================
 1129: %%%==== Internal functions ========================================
 1130: %%%================================================================
 1131: 
 1132: chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1133:               ExpectedKex,
 1134:               ExpectedCiphers,
 1135:               ServerPrefOpts) ->
 1136:     %% Start the daemon
 1137:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(
 1138:                       [{send_ext_info,false},
 1139:                        {recv_ext_info,false},
 1140:                        {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}
 1141:                        | ServerPrefOpts])
 1142:     of
 1143:         {_,Host,Port} ->
 1144:             %% Check the Kex part
 1145:             ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1146:               [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
 1147:                {connect, Host, Port,
 1148:                 [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1149:                  {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1150:                  {user_interaction, false}
 1151:                 ]},
 1152:                {send, hello},
 1153:                receive_hello,
 1154:                {match,
 1155:                 #ssh_msg_kexinit{
 1156:                    kex_algorithms = to_lists(ExpectedKex),
 1157:                    encryption_algorithms_server_to_client = to_lists(ExpectedCiphers),
 1158:                    _   = '_'},
 1159:                 receive_msg}
 1160:               ]);
 1161:         Error ->
 1162:             Error
 1163:     end.
 1164: 
 1165: 
 1166: filter_supported(K, Algs) -> Algs -- (Algs--supported(K)).
 1167: 
 1168: supported(_K) -> proplists:get_value(
 1169:                    server2client,
 1170:                    ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(cipher)).
 1171: 
 1172: to_lists(L) -> lists:map(fun erlang:atom_to_list/1, L).
 1173:     
 1174: 
 1175: %%%---- init_suite and end_suite ---------------------------------------	
 1176: start_apps(Config) ->
 1177:     catch ssh:stop(),
 1178:     ok = ssh:start(),
 1179:     Config.
 1180: 
 1181: stop_apps(_Config) ->
 1182:     ssh:stop().
 1183: 
 1184: 
 1185: setup_dirs(Config) ->
 1186:     ct:log("Pub keys setup for: ~p",
 1187:            [ssh_test_lib:setup_all_user_host_keys(Config)]),
 1188:     Config.
 1189: 
 1190: system_dir(Config) -> filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system).
 1191: 
 1192: user_dir(Config) -> proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
 1193: 
 1194: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1195: start_std_daemon(Config) ->	
 1196:     start_std_daemon(Config, []).
 1197: 
 1198: start_std_daemon(Config, ExtraOpts) ->
 1199:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), 
 1200:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1201:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1202:     UserPasswords = [{"user1","pwd1"}],
 1203:     Options = [%%{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-rsa']}]}, %% For some test cases
 1204: 	       {system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
 1205: 	       {user_dir, UserDir},
 1206: 	       {user_passwords, UserPasswords},
 1207: 	       {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}
 1208: 	       | ExtraOpts],
 1209:     Ref = {Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon(Options),
 1210:     ct:log("Std server ~p started at ~p:~p~nOptions=~p",[Server, Host, Port, Options]),
 1211:     [{server,Ref}, {user_passwords, UserPasswords} | Config].
 1212: 
 1213: 
 1214: stop_std_daemon(Config) ->
 1215:     ssh:stop_daemon(ssh_test_lib:server_pid(Config)),
 1216:     ct:log("Std server ~p at ~p:~p stopped",
 1217:            [ssh_test_lib:server_pid(Config), ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),
 1218:             ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)]),
 1219:     lists:keydelete(server, 1, Config).
 1220: 
 1221: 
 1222: check_std_daemon_works(Config, Line) ->
 1223:     case std_connect(Config) of
 1224: 	{ok,C} ->
 1225: 	    ct:log("Server ~p:~p ~p is ok at line ~p",
 1226: 		   [ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config), ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1227: 		    ssh_test_lib:server_pid(Config), Line]),
 1228: 	    ok = ssh:close(C),
 1229: 	    Config;
 1230: 	Error = {error,_} ->
 1231: 	    ct:fail("Standard server ~p:~p ~p is ill at line ~p: ~p",
 1232: 		    [ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config), ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1233: 		     ssh_test_lib:server_pid(Config), Line, Error])
 1234:     end.
 1235: 
 1236: server_user_password(Config) -> server_user_password(1, Config).
 1237: 
 1238: server_user_password(N, Config) -> lists:nth(N, ?v(user_passwords,Config)).
 1239: 
 1240: std_connect(Config) ->
 1241:     std_connect({ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),
 1242:                  ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)}, Config).
 1243: 
 1244: std_connect({Host,Port}, Config) ->
 1245:     std_connect({Host,Port}, Config, []).
 1246: 
 1247: std_connect({Host,Port}, Config, Opts) ->
 1248:     std_connect(Host, Port, Config, Opts).
 1249: 
 1250: std_connect(Host, Port, Config, Opts) ->
 1251:     {User,Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
 1252:     ssh:connect(Host, Port, 
 1253: 		%% Prefer User's Opts to the default opts
 1254: 		[O || O = {Tag,_} <- [{user,User},{password,Pwd},
 1255: 				      {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1256:                                       {save_accepted_host, false},
 1257: 				      {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1258: 				      {user_interaction, false}],
 1259: 		      not lists:keymember(Tag, 1, Opts)
 1260: 		] ++ Opts,
 1261: 		30000).
 1262:     
 1263: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------	
 1264: connect_and_kex(Config) ->
 1265:     connect_and_kex(Config, ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([]) ).
 1266: 
 1267: connect_and_kex(Config, InitialState) ->
 1268:     ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1269:       [{connect,
 1270: 	ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1271: 	[{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1272:                                 {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
 1273:                                ]},
 1274:          {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1275:          {recv_ext_info, false},
 1276: 	 {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1277: 	 {user_interaction, false}
 1278:          | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
 1279:         ]},
 1280:        receive_hello,
 1281:        {send, hello},
 1282:        {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
 1283:        {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1284:        {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_init},
 1285:        {match,# ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1286:        {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
 1287:        {match, #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg}
 1288:       ],
 1289:       InitialState).
 1290: 
 1291: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1292: 
 1293: %%% For matching peer disconnection
 1294: disconnect() ->
 1295:     disconnect('_').
 1296: 
 1297: disconnect(Code) ->
 1298:     {'or',[#ssh_msg_disconnect{code = Code,
 1299: 			       _='_'},
 1300: 	   tcp_closed,
 1301: 	   {tcp_error,econnaborted}
 1302: 	  ]}.
